meanings.definition: To change the pattern or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: She repatterns her daily routine to include more exercise.
meanings.sent2: The artist repatterns the design to make it more appealing.
meanings.sent3: He repatterns his sock drawer every week just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm repatterns the landscape, leaving a new path.
meanings.sent5: The teacher repatterns the classroom layout for better learning.

meanings.definition: To create a new pattern or structure.
meanings.sent1: The fashion designer repatterns the fabric for a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The architect repatterns the building layout for efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The chef repatterns the ingredients to invent a new dish.
meanings.sent4: The musician repatterns the melody, creating a fresh sound.
meanings.sent5: The gardener repatterns the flowerbeds for a beautiful garden.

meanings.sent1: She repatterns her bookshelf to fit more books.
meanings.sent2: The manager repatterns the work schedule for better productivity.
meanings.sent3: He repatterns his desk clutter into a neat arrangement.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces repattern into a complete picture.
meanings.sent5: The team repatterns their strategy for the upcoming game.
